articles.content:
Special envoy of UN Secretary General asserts DPRK-U.S. direct dialogue 
    Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Moris Strong, special envoy of the UN Secretary General, on March 18 underlined the need for the DPRK and the U.S. to hold direct talks, noting that there is no possibility of peacefully settling the "nuclear issue" of Korea without dialogue, according to a news report.
 As regards the "nuclear issue" of Korea, a peaceful solution to it can be found when dialogue started, he noted.    
 The escalating Iraq crisis strongly underscores the necessity for the DPRK and the U.S. to pursue a peace dialogue, he added.

articles.content:
Greetings to Iranian President 
    Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of greeting to Seyed Mohammad Khatami, President of Iran, on the occasion of the New Year of Iran.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the president and the fraternal people of Iran on the occasion of the New Year of Iran and expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, too.    
 It wished the president and people of Iran greater successes in the work for the development and prosperity of the country and the president good health and happiness.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam meets special envoy of U.N. Secretary General
articles.content:
"Love-Neighbor Society" visiting group arrives 
    Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A visiting group of the "Love-Neighbor Society" of South Korea led by its chairman Ri Il Ha arrived here today.
 They were greeted at the airport by Ho Hyok Phil, vice-chairman of the National Reconciliation Council, and officials concerned with compatriotic feelings.

articles.title: National symposium held
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam meets special envoy of U.N. Secretary General
    Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a conversation with Moris Strong, special envoy of the U.N. Secretary General, and his companion at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there were Choe Su Hon, vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs, and Masood Hyder, U.N. resident coordinator and resident representative of the UNDP here.    
 The special envoy asked the president to convey the greetings of Kofi Annan, U.N. Secretary General, to leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.content:
Congratulations to President of Trinidad and Tobago
    Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to George Maxwell Richard on the occasion of his assumption of office as president of Trinidad and Tobago.
 Expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would favorably develop in the interests of the two peoples in the future, the message wished the president success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.content:
Congratulations to President of Serbia and Montenegro
    Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- President Kim Yong Nam of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Svetozar Marovic upon his election as President of Serbia and Montenegro.
 The message expressed belief that the relations between the two countries would favorably develop in the future and wished the president success in his work for the peace and stability of the country and the people of Serbia and Montenegro prosperity.
